medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started in the morning after a small bowel movement and crescendoed over a few hours to a severe pain that did not resolve upon taking Tylenol. Pain was described as diffuse and crampy. The patient had another regular bowel movement at home with no changes in color or melena. The patient also reports chills and headache in the morning. The symptoms are similar to a previous episode of passing a gallstone. The patient reports slowly resolving pain after admission to the emergency department and now describes her pain as similar in quality but less intense.
medical_history.past_medical_history: DM II, HTN, HLD, OA, reactive airway disease, CAD
